body.p: Native of Tennessee. Worked as a lawyer in Simpson County. Active in Democratic politics, he served as secretary of a meeting of Simpson County Democrats in 1858. Attended, as a delegate of Simpson County, the Kentucky Democratic Convention in 1858. Finn was chosen to be a delegate to the Democratic National Convention representing the Third District of Kentucky in favor of the candidacy of James Guthrie in 1860. He was the elector for Stephen A. Douglas in Kentucky's Third Congressional District during the presidential election of 1860.

Spouse: Marie B Finn
Children: Mary C Finn, Ella F Finn,
